alert.note: Alert for Cayuga; Schuyler; Seneca; Steuben; Yates (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 27 at 3:37PM EDT by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 530 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central New York, including the following counties, Southern Cayuga, Schuyler, Seneca, Steuben and Yates. * WHEN...Until 530 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas is expected. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 336 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Watch out for ponding on roadways and poor drainage flooding. - Some locations that could experience minor flooding include... Auburn, Seneca Falls, Waterloo, Penn Yan, Dundee, Hector, Romulus, Sennett, Starkey, Benton, Pulteney, Montezuma, Union Springs, Aurora, Ovid, Interlaken, Cayuga, Burdett, Dresden and Lodi. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
